refnamediv.refpurpose:
substitute
nulls, replacing
replacing nulls Substitute new value for null values in an array

refsect1.title: Summary
refsect1.para: Substitute null values in one array with non-null values from another array.

The substitute operator renders attributes in null_array non-nullable. If an attribute has null values, you can use this operator to substitute null values in the array and change the nullability of the attribute in the schema.

listitem.para: The starting indices for both arrays must be zero.
The substitute array must have exactly one attribute.

informalexample.para: This example replaces all null values in an array with zero.

step.para: Create an array m4x4_null with a nullable attribute: --afl CREATE ARRAY m4x4_null <val:double null>[i=0:3,4,0,j=0:3,4,0]; --show-output=no --show-query=yes
Store null in the second row of m4x4_null and 100 in all the other cells: --afl store(build(m4x4_null,iif(i=1,null,100)),m4x4_null); --show-query=yes --show-output=yes
Create a single-cell array called substitute_array --afl CREATE ARRAY substitute_array <missing:double>[i=0:0,1,0]; --show-output=no
Use the substitute operator to replace the null-valued cells in m4x4_null with 0-valued cells: --afl substitute(m4x4_null,substitute_array); --show-query=yes --show-output=yes
